body:
@labkeeper when you build with `container-image-docker` does the build actually work? The Docker extension has always supported podman and should work. The message `Using executable podman within the quarkus-container-image-docker extension. Maybe you should use the quarkus-container-image-podman extension instead?` is just an informational message.

That being said, I will investigate the podman extension because something isn't right there.

issue.title: Add podman to gradle task for checking available image builders

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

issue.body:
This must have been missed in the original podman container image implementation.

Fixes #47153

body: #47155 will fix the `container-image-podman` issue, but I'm not sure there actually is an issue when using `container-image-docker`
